name: 1 - First Steps
descr: Added to the discipline's repository.

name: 2 - Exploring a Project's Environment
descr: Researched the history and community of people and services around a project.

name: 3 - Undocumented Project
descr: Received an undocumented system and got it up and running.

name: 4 - Professional Project
descr: Refactored poorly written code and created a web page for it.

name: 5 - Tested and Approved
descr: Created unit tests and interface tests for the challenge server.

name: 6 - Python Package
descr: Created a Python package installable via pip.

name: 7 - Dockerfile
descr: Created automated deployment for a Python web system.

name: 8 - Basic Translation
descr: Used translation tools to translate and localize a small command-line program.

name: 10 - FLOSS Research
descr: Delivered a long presentation on a recent and relevant topic related to free and open-source software.

name: 21 - Code Contribution
descr: Submitted a pull request fixing a bug.

name: 22 - Contribution Accepted!
descr: A non-trivial pull request was accepted by an external project.

name: 23 - Simple Contribution Accepted!
descr: A simple pull request (with trivial changes or small code refactorings) was accepted by an external project.

name: 24 - Bug Report
descr: Reported a bug in a repository, and another user was able to reproduce it.

name: 25 - Feature Request
descr: Made a request for a new feature in a software.

name: 26 - INSPER Project
descr: Made additional contributions to an INSPER educational project.

name: 40 - Indirect Issue
descr: Conversations in an issue or pull request led other users to open issues reporting new bugs/improvements.

name: 41 - Beta Tester
descr: When reproducing a bug, you discovered that it had already been fixed and caused the closure of an issue.

name: 42 - Translation Accepted!
descr: Made a translation that was accepted in an open-source software.

name: 43 - New Languages
descr: Added support for translations in a previously non-translatable software.

name: 44 - Reviewer
descr: Reviewed minor errors in the documentation of a project, and your modifications were accepted.

name: 45 - Documentation Contribution
descr: Closed an issue marked as `docs`.

name: 46 - Project Pitch
descr: Delivered a project pitch.

name: 47 - Pitch Accepted!
descr: Contributed to a project presented in class.

name: 48 - Accepted Suggestion!
descr: Another student contributed to the project you pitched.

name: 49 - PR Replay
descr: Presented (in 15 minutes) the process of resolving a bug in class.

name: 60 - Speaker
descr: Gave a talk about libraries or open-source software.

name: 61 - Helpdesk
descr: Had an accepted answer on sites like StackOverflow or email lists.

name: 62 - Published Contribution
descr: One of your contributions was included in a release.

name: 63 - VIP Guest
descr: After making a contribution, someone from the project asked you to perform a task. After delivering the task, add this skill.

name: 64 - 3 Submitted PRs
descr: Submitted 3 pull requests to the same project.

name: 65 - 3 Accepted PRs
descr: 3 pull requests you submitted to a project were accepted.

name: 66 - Shoutout
descr: Something you did was mentioned by the project on social media or through an official channel.

name: 77 - Hacktoberfest
descr: Participated in Hacktoberfest by submitting 3 pull requests to external projects.
